column4: wow the apt-get just asked me to insert my gutsy gribbon cd then press enter. is that right?
I think it asks me for gutsy CD because I have to upgrade my sources.list or something?
how did you go?
give us a sec mate!
Okay
have a look at IntuitiveNipple's post above: <quote> Try removing the directory "/home/org/.cpan/build/DBI-1.59" and then running install again, so that 'make' can run correctly </quote>
try removing the folder again then quit cpan shell and start again
last few lines again from new shell/cpan http://pastebin.com/m2226801
do you have build essential installed?
not sure about that. whats build essential?
build essential is the gcc compiler package for ubuntu. do apt-get install build-essential
righty
then see how you go
I just got a fresh gutsy install :)
whats also important things to install such as build-essentail for a new system? :)
From experience in 7.04 Ubuntu does not install build essential as standard
Perl may have C/C++ modules in the code
oh ok
open a terminal and type sudo apt-get-install build-essential
I did. it asked me for gutsy CD
why does it ask me for CD when I try to apt-get every now and then. It's weird. never happened to me in fiesty
now I got DBI installed perfectly thanks mate
Fantastic, good to hear
